SQL Skills: Strong expertise in SQL Server; ability to write complex joins and validate data models. Reporting Knowledge: Experience testing high-fidelity reports (Windward, Crystal Reports, or SSRS) is highly preferred. API Testing: Hands-on experience testing RESTful APIs and understanding backend architecture. Technical Familiarity: Understanding of containerized environments (Kubernetes/Docker) and CI/CD workflows. Communication: Fluent English communication skills for effective collaboration with global teams. Responsibilities & Context Job Context: We are seeking a detail-oriented QA Engineer to ensure the quality, reliability, and accuracy of our financial backend systems and reporting platforms. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in testing .NET Core applications, validating complex SQL Server data, and ensuring that report migrations (Legacy to Windward/Apryse) are pixel-perfect. This role requires a blend of manual precision and automated testing within an Agile environment. Responsibilities: Report & Document Validation: Perform rigorous "side-by-side" testing of migrated reports (Crystal/SSRS to Windward) to ensure 100% data and formatting accuracy. API Testing: Validate RESTful APIs using tools like Postman or Swagger to ensure backend services meet functional requirements. Database Testing: Write complex SQL queries to verify data integrity, stored procedure logic, and backend calculations. Regression Testing: Execute manual and automated regression suites to ensure new .NET Core deployments do not impact existing financial logic. Defect Management: Identify, document, and track software defects using Azure DevOps or similar tools. Environment Support: Collaborate with the DevOps team to validate deployments within Docker/Kubernetes and Linux environments. Agile Collaboration: Participate in Scrum ceremonies and collaborate with Software Engineers and Business stakeholders to define clear acceptance criteria. Compensation & Other Benefits Weekly 2 holidays Lunch Facilities: Full Subsidize Workplace Work at office Employment Status Contractual Job Location Dhaka Job Highlights Experience with automated testing frameworks

job_description: Jr.Executive/ Executive - Sales & Marketing - Real Estate Company : Shopnodhora Assets Development Ltd Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Shopnodhora Assets Development Ltd Jr.Executive/ Executive - Sales & Marketing - Real Estate Company Application Deadline : 25 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Company Information Summary Vacancy: -- Location: Dhaka (GULSHAN 1) Salary: Negotiable Published: 26 Feb 2026 Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Only Male 1-2 years of experience in land/plot sales. Freshers can only apply for junior executive positions, and they will be selected for junior executive positions. In-depth understanding of land sales processes, property registration, and mutation procedures. Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle multiple client portfolios and field visits. Proficiency in basic legal understanding of land-related matters. Knowledge of real estate trends, property laws, and the local market. Responsibilities & Context Sales Generation: Identify, target, and acquire new clients through proactive marketing and networking to build a robust pipeline. Site Viewings & Promotion: Arrange and conduct property site visits, showcasing land features, and conducting open houses to attract potential buyers. Negotiation & Closing: Negotiate prices, contract terms, and payment plans, closing deals to meet or exceed monthly/annual revenue goals. Compliance & Documentation: Ensure all land transactions comply with legal requirements and collaborate with legal/finance teams. Identify and contact potential land buyers (individuals, businesses, investors) Present land projects, location advantages, and pricing details Conduct site visits and property tours for clients Explain legal documents, ownership details, and payment plans Negotiate prices and close sales deals Maintain customer relationships for repeat business and referrals Achieve monthly/quarterly sales targets Coordinate with marketing and legal teams Maintain records of leads, calls, and transactions Convert leads into confirmed sales Deliver premium client experience to enhance brand loyalty. Skills & Expertise Real Estate Business Real Estate Development Real Estate Management Real Estate Marketing Real Estate Sales Real state Developer Sales & Marketing Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Gender Only males are allowed to apply. job_description: MEAL Officer : Association of Voluntary Actions for Society (AVAS) Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Association of Voluntary Actions for Society (AVAS) MEAL Officer Application Deadline : 06 Mar 2026 Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 01 Age: 25 to 45 years Location: Patuakhali (Galachipa) Salary: Tk. 45000 - 48000 (Monthly) Published: 26 Feb 2026 Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 25 to 45 years Responsibilities & Context Responsibilities & Context Association of Voluntary Actions for Society (AVAS) is a national non-profit, rights-based development organization working since 1998 to improve the lives of vulnerable and marginalized communities across Bangladesh. AVAS implements programs in health, gender equality, child protection, climate resilience, livelihood development, education and humanitarian response through strong community engagement and partnerships with government and international development agencies. The organization is committed to accountability, safeguarding, inclusion and sustainable community development. Project Summary The RMNCAH Project aims to strengthen equitable access to quality reproductive, maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent health services at community and facility levels. The programme supports health system strengthening, demand generation, referral pathway improvement, safeguarding integration, and community accountability mechanisms in alignment with national health strategies and donor compliance frameworks. The project emphasizes results-based management, data-driven decision-making, gender equality, and accountability to affected populations. Position Summary The MEAL Officer will lead the implementation and continuous strengthening of the Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning (MEAL) system in line with donor contractual requirements and international best practices. The role will ensure high-quality data collection, verification, analysis, and reporting to measure performance against logframe indicators and ensure compliance with donor visibility, safeguarding, and accountability standards. The MEAL Officer will support adaptive management by generating evidence, identifying implementation gaps, and promoting learning across project components. Key Duties and Responsibilities 1. Monitoring & Results Management Develop and operationalize the project MEAL Plan aligned with the approved logframe and Results Framework. Maintain Indicator Performance Tracking Tables (IPTT) and ensure systematic tracking of output, outcome, and impact indicators. Design data collection tools, guidelines, and reporting templates in compliance with donor requirements. Conduct regular field monitoring visits to assess quality, relevance, coverage, and adherence to technical standards.

DevSecOps Engineer (CADE ‚Äì Cloud & Security Automation) Application Deadline : 28 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Age: At least 25 years Location: Dhaka Salary: Negotiable Published: 26 Feb 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age At least 25 years Responsibilities & Context About the Role: Axiler Ltd. is looking for a DevSecOps Engineer to support the CADE platform , a leading Cloud & Security Automation system. You will build resilient infrastructure, automate secure deployments, and ensure real-time scalability across multi-cloud environments, enabling CADE to deliver high-performance, secure, and adaptive protection at scale. Key Responsibilities: CI/CD & Automation: Build and maintain secure pipelines for MERN and Python APIs (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, ArgoCD). Implement DevSecOps gates (SAST, DAST, IaC scanning, dependency checks) to catch vulnerabilities early. Cloud & Orchestration: Automate deployments and scaling in Kubernetes (EKS/GKE/AKS) with zero-downtime rollouts. Implement IaC using Terraform, Helm, and Ansible for reproducible environments. Security Automation: Integrate compliance-as-code, zero-trust access models, policy enforcement (OPA/Kyverno). Automate vulnerability scanning, container signing, and secret management (Vault, SOPS, Sealed Secrets). Monitoring & Observability: Ensure full observability via Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/EFK, and Datadog. Build alerting pipelines with automated incident response hooks (SOAR). Performance & Reliability: Optimize system performance, scalability, and cost efficiency. Drive disaster recovery planning, backup automation, and multi-region failover readiness. Collaboration: Partner with development teams to embed DevSecOps best practices. Promote shift-left security, treating compliance as code from the start. Requirements: 6+ years DevOps/SRE experience in production-grade systems. Graduates from public universities (BUET, KUET, RUET, CUET) will get preference. Strong experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP (multi-cloud preferred). Hands-on Kubernetes, Docker, and container orchestration. Proficiency in CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, ArgoCD). Strong scripting in Python and Bash (Go is a plus). Knowledge of secure deployments, secrets management, zero-trust architecture, and compliance frameworks (SOC 2, PCI-DSS, ISO 27001). Nice to Have: Experience in cybersecurity or security-focused DevOps. Familiarity with SIEM/SOAR platforms and compliance automation. Open-source DevOps or security tooling contributions. Officer and Executive Officer (Internal Audit Department) : Primeasia University Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Primeasia University Officer and Executive Officer (Internal Audit Department) Application Deadline : 12 Mar 2026 Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: -- Location: Dhaka (Banani) Salary: Negotiable Published: 26 Feb 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Responsibilities & Context Preparing a yearly and monthly audit plan. Assist in conducting pre-audit and post-audit as per audit program and management requirements. Contribute to finding out the weaknesses of the auditing system of the university in various aspects and recover in priority basis. Checking / Monitoring Tally Software Accounting Data To ensure that the audit reports are accurate, match the audit objective, and contain recommendations. To coordinate and communicate with the Management regarding Audit issues. Ability to keep documents, study, and internet data, and make a report. Strong analytical skills that help observe, evaluate, and draw inferences. Prepare different monthly reports and a weekly report. Check Cash & Bank book, ledger, different types of registers, etc. Identifying and fixing gaps in procurement, dispatch, and display process. Carried out accounts and systems auditing & figured out discrepancies & inefficiencies. To check and verify all store requisition, delivery challan, MRR, bill, voucher etc. Ensure physical verification of stock & cash. Ensuring that the University`s fixed Assets & properties are safeguarded. Assessing how well the University is complying with the Rules, Regulations & Policies of the UGC Guidelines and informing the Management whether any issues need to be addressed. Visiting to different departments, meeting relevant staff Members and obtaining Information & Documents. Perform any other duties as assigned by the management from time to time. Skills & Expertise Auditing skill Compensation & Other Benefits As per the University policy. 02 weekly holidays. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 25 to 35 years Only Male Essential ‚Ä¢ 1‚Äì3 years‚Äô experience in accounts admin / purchase ledger support ‚Ä¢ Good data entry accuracy ‚Ä¢ Basic Excel and computer skills ‚Ä¢ Strong organisation and attention to detail Desirable ‚Ä¢ Experience in retail or stock-based business ‚Ä¢ Exposure to invoice processing or finance administration ‚Ä¢ Experience working in a structured finance team PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED ‚Ä¢ Careful and accurate ‚Ä¢ Organised and dependable ‚Ä¢ Willing to learn ‚Ä¢ Good team player ‚Ä¢ Disciplined and consistent ‚Ä¢ Honest and responsible Responsibilities & Context 1. ROLE PURPOSE The Purchase Ledger Assistant supports the purchase ledger function by ensuring invoices, documents, and supplier records are processed accurately and efficiently. This role helps maintain: ‚Ä¢ Accurate invoice entry support ‚Ä¢ Proper document filing ‚Ä¢ Timely follow-up of missing paperwork ‚Ä¢ Clean supplier records ‚Ä¢ Smooth day-to-day purchase ledger administration This is a support role, but it must be carried out with high accuracy and discipline. 2. PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITY (NON-NEGOTIABLE) The Purchase Ledger Assistant is fully accountable for: ‚Ä¢ Timely preparation and organisation of purchase documents ‚Ä¢ Accurate data entry support ‚Ä¢ Proper filing of invoices and supporting paperwork ‚Ä¢ Prompt follow-up of missing approvals or documents ‚Ä¢ Supporting ledger accuracy through disciplined admin work If paperwork is missing, records are disorganised, or data is entered incorrectly ‚Äî this role owns the first-line failure. 3. CORE RESPONSIBILITIES A. DOCUMENT COLLECTION & ORGANISATION ‚Ä¢ Collect supplier invoices and related documents ‚Ä¢ Organise: o Purchase invoices o Delivery notes o Credit notes o Approval records ‚Ä¢ Ensure paperwork is properly labelled and filed B. DATA ENTRY SUPPORT ‚Ä¢ Enter approved invoice information into the system as instructed ‚Ä¢ Check for basic completeness before entry ‚Ä¢ Ensure supplier names, dates, references, and amounts are entered accurately ‚Ä¢ Flag unclear or incomplete documents to the Purchase Ledger Officer C. FILING & AUDIT TRAIL MAINTENANCE ‚Ä¢ Maintain digital and/or physical filing systems ‚Ä¢ Ensure all processed invoices are easy to trace ‚Ä¢ Keep records in date order and supplier order where required ‚Ä¢ Support audit readiness through clean document storage D. FOLLOW-UP OF MISSING INFORMATION ‚Ä¢ Chase missing: o Approvals o Delivery notes o Credit notes o Supplier documents ‚Ä¢

Purchase Ledger Officer : Euro Foods Group Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Euro Foods Group Purchase Ledger Officer Application Deadline : 28 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Age: 25 to 35 years Location: Bangladesh Salary: Negotiable Published: 26 Feb 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. Application Insights View Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 25 to 35 years Only Male Essential ‚Ä¢ 3‚Äì5+ years‚Äô experience in purchase ledger / accounts payable ‚Ä¢ Strong invoice processing and reconciliation experience ‚Ä¢ Good Excel and accounting system knowledge ‚Ä¢ High attention to detail and control mindset Desirable ‚Ä¢ Experience in retail, wholesale, or multi-site business ‚Ä¢ Experience supporting UK-based operations from offshore ‚Ä¢ Familiarity with supplier-heavy environments and stock-based purchasing PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED ‚Ä¢ Accurate and methodical ‚Ä¢ Strong ownership mindset ‚Ä¢ Organised and disciplined ‚Ä¢ Good problem solver ‚Ä¢ Calm under pressure ‚Ä¢ Honest and reliable Responsibilities & Context 1. ROLE PURPOSE The Purchase Ledger Officer is responsible for controlling the purchase invoice and supplier payment process across the business. This role ensures: ‚Ä¢ Supplier invoices are checked accurately ‚Ä¢ Purchase records are complete and correctly coded ‚Ä¢ Payments are prepared on time ‚Ä¢ Supplier balances are reconciled ‚Ä¢ Errors, duplicates, and overpayments are prevented This is not just a data-entry role. It is a control and accuracy role within the finance function. 2. PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITY (NON-NEGOTIABLE) The Purchase Ledger Officer is fully accountable for: ‚Ä¢ Accurate entry of supplier invoices ‚Ä¢ Correct matching of invoices to purchase records and approvals ‚Ä¢ Timely preparation of payment runs ‚Ä¢ Reconciliation of supplier statements ‚Ä¢ Identification and escalation of discrepancies ‚Ä¢ Maintaining a clean, auditable purchase ledger If supplier balances are wrong, invoices are missed, or duplicate/incorrect payments are made ‚Äî this role owns it. 3. CORE RESPONSIBILITIES A.
